title: Envelope, "Miss Holloway", late 19th–early 20th century
inscribed: in graphite in center of recto: Miss Holloway / addressed
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Jacob H. Schiff
description: Square cream envelope with embossed borders.  There is a very wide border of floral branches that spring from the border's center with in a frame.  The center of the bordered region is large and has the following inscribed in graphite: Miss Holloway / addressed.  In the upper left quarter of the recto of the envelope is a large burn, with the shadow of another burn parallel to it.

tombstone.epitaph: Envelope, "Miss Holloway", late 19th–early 20th century. graphite on cream wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of Jacob H. Schiff. 1949-37-50.
